file_summary:
This `VetController` class serves as a Spring MVC controller responsible for handling web requests related to veterinary professionals in the Spring PetClinic application. It is annotated with `@Controller`, indicating its role in the presentation layer. The controller injects `VetRepository` to interact with the data layer for retrieving vet information.

Its primary functions include providing two distinct endpoints:
1.  `/vets.html`: This endpoint renders a paginated list of vets to a web page (`vets/vetList`). It manages the pagination logic, allowing users to browse vets page by page, displaying details like current page, total pages, and total items.
2.  `/vets`: This endpoint exposes a RESTful API, returning a `Vets` object (a wrapper for a list of `Vet` objects) as JSON or XML. This is designed for programmatic consumption, offering a complete list of all veterinarians.

The controller encapsulates the logic for fetching vet data, applying pagination where necessary, and preparing it for both human-readable web views and machine-readable API responses.

functions.name: VetController
functions.description: Constructor for VetController, injecting the VetRepository dependency.

functions.name: showVetList
functions.description: Handles GET requests to '/vets.html', displaying a paginated list of veterinarians to the web UI. It fetches a page of vets and adds pagination details to the model.

functions.name: addPaginationModel
functions.description: Helper method to add pagination attributes (currentPage, totalPages, totalItems, listVets) to the Model for UI rendering.

functions.name: findPaginated
functions.description: Helper method to retrieve a paginated list of vets from the VetRepository. Sets the page size to 5.

functions.name: showResourcesVetList
functions.description: Handles GET requests to '/vets', returning a list of all veterinarians as a RESTful resource (JSON/XML). This is suitable for client-side consumption.
